intro: Pedicularis paiana, commonly known as the Alpine monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in rocky or alpine environments, often at high altitudes where temperatures are cool. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
